venue.address_1: One mile north of Hampton Beach
venue.name: North Beach

item.description:
Let’s get together for a sunrise walk at Hampton Beach.  I know this is not technically “North Shore” but in talking to some of our North Shore members from Salisbury, Amesbury, Newbury area, they felt this was convenient and a good place to walk- and since I’m off that day and will be starting off up 95 on my holiday trek at that time, I figured I’d post and see who could join me. 

 I’m going to try to arrive early enough to catch the real sunrise, but we’ll start walking at 5:45 AM from North Beach- so technically after sunrise :)   North Beach is the smaller beach North of Hampton Beach as most of us know it.  There is a parking area there.   It’s low tide, so we should have a great expanse of beach, and will walk down North Beach, and then pick up the sidewalk to scoot over to Hampton Beach itself.  After walking the length of Hampton Beach, we’ll turn around and do the trek back to the cars (sand and/or pavement).  So plan for about 5-6 miles total roundtrip at a brisk pace...probably 5:30-7 AM or so (although you can turn around at whatever point you need to). For anyone so inclined, I may grab a bagel and coffee at KB's Bagels (right around the corner) afterwards. 

 

Bring your coffee, a camera if you like to catch sunrise pics, and your early morning energy! This is a great time at the beach, and an excellent way to start the day. See you then!

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Sunrise Beach Walk in Hampton- low tide, great weather!
